Statements: Only good singers are invited in the conference. No one without sweet voice is a good singer.
Conclusions:

All invited singers in the conference have sweet voice. 
Those singers who do not have sweet voice are not invited in the conference.
test_questions.opte: Both I and II follow
test_questions.explanation: The statement asserts that a good singer always has a sweet voice and only good singers are invited in the conference. This implies that all those invited in the conference have sweet voice and those who do not have sweet voice are not invited. So, both I and II follow.

test_questions.question:
Statements: To cultivate interest in reading, the school has made it compulsory from June this year for each student to read two books per week and submit a weekly report on the books.
Conclusions:

Interest in reading can be created by force.
Some students will eventually develop interest in reading.
test_questions.opte: Both I and II follow
test_questions.explanation: Clearly, the new scheme intends to develop interest in reading by incorporating the habit in their routine. So, only II follows while I does not.

test_questions.question:
Statements: Applications of applicants who do no fulfil eligibility criteria and/or who do not submit applications before last date will be summarily rejected and will not be called for the written test.
Conclusions:

Those who are called for the written test are those who fulfil eligibility criteria and have submitted their applications before last date.
Written test will be held only after scrutiny of applications.
test_questions.opte: Both I and II follow
test_questions.explanation: The statement clearly mentions that fulfilling the eligibility criteria and submitting the application before the stipulated date are both essential to avoid rejection. So, I follows. Also, since it is given that the candidates whose applications are rejected shall not be called for written test, so II also follows.

test_questions.question:
Statements: Recent trends also indicate that the number of child migrants in large cities is increasing. These children leave their families to join the ranks of urban poor doing odd jobs in markets, workshops, hotels or in service sectors.
Conclusions:

Migration to big cities should be checked. 
The plight of poor children should be thoroughly studied.
test_questions.opte: Both I and II follow
test_questions.explanation: The statement mentions the problem of increased migration of children to cities. But the ways to deal with the problem cannot be deduced from it. So, neither I nor II follows.

test_questions.question:
Statements: No country is absolutely self-dependent these days.
Conclusions:

It is impossible to grow and produce all that a country needs.
Countrymen in general have become lazy.
test_questions.opte: Both I and II follow
test_questions.explanation: Clearly, only I provides a suitable explanation to the given statement. So, only I follows.

test_questions.question:
Statements: The percentage of the national income shared by the top 10 per cent of households in India is 35.
Conclusions:

When an economy grows fast, concentration of wealth in certain pockets of population takes place. 
The national income is unevenly distributed in India.
test_questions.opte: Both I and II follow
test_questions.explanation: Nothing about the growth of economy is mentioned in the statement. So, I does not follow. Also, it is given that 35 per cent of national income is shared by 10 per cent of households. This indicates unequal distribution. So, II follows.

test_questions.question:
Statements: Players who break various records in a fair way get special prizes. Player X broke the world record but was found to be under the influence of a prohibited drug.
Conclusions:

X will get the special prize.
X will not get the special prize.
test_questions.opte: Both I and II follow
test_questions.explanation: Clearly, X will not get the special prize because although he broke the world record, he was found to use unfair means. So, II follows while I does not.

test_questions.question:
Statements: Company X has marketed the product. Go ahead; purchase it if price and quality are your considerations.
Conclusions:

The product must be good in quality.
The price of the product must be reasonable.
test_questions.opte: Both I and II follow
test_questions.explanation: It is mentioned in the statement that one who considers price and quality before buying a product should buy the product of company X. So, both I and II follow.

test_questions.question:
Statements: Quality has a price tag. India is allocating lots of funds to education.
Conclusions:

Quality of education in India would improve soon.
Funding alone can enhance quality of education.
test_questions.opte: Both I and II follow
test_questions.explanation: According to the statement, funding is necessary to improve quality and India is allocating funds to education. This means that quality of education will improve in India. So, I follows. But funding alone is sufficient to enhance quality, is not true. So, II does not follow.

test_questions.question:
Statements: Although we have rating agencies like Crisil, ICRA, there is demand to have a separate rating agency for IT companies to protect investors.
Conclusions:

Assessment of financial worth of IT companies calls for separate set of skills, insight and competencies. 
Now the investors investing in IT companies will get protection of their investment.
test_questions.opte: Both I and II follow
test_questions.explanation: The need for separate rating agency for IT companies clearly indicates that such assessment requires a separate set of skills. So, I follows. However, the statement indicates only the need or demand and neither the future course of action nor its after-effects can be judged. So, II does not follow.

test_questions.question:
Statements: The standard of education in private schools is much better than Municipal and Zila Parishad-run schools.
Conclusions:

The Municipal and Zila Pariskad should make serious efforts to improve standard of their schools.
All Municipal and Zila Parishad schools should be closed immediately.
test_questions.opte: Both I and II follow
test_questions.explanation: Clearly, the solution to the problem is not to close down the Municipal and Zila Parishad-run schools but to strive to improve the standard of education of these schools. So, only I follows while II does not.

test_questions.question:
Statements: All the organised persons find time for rest. Sunita, in spite of her very busy schedule, finds time for rest.
Conclusions:

Sunita is an organised person.
Sunita is an industrious person.
test_questions.opte: Both I and II follow
test_questions.explanation: Sunita has a very busy schedule. This means that she is industrious. But still she finds time for rest. This means that she is an organised person. So, both I and II follow.

test_questions.question:
Statements: Domestic demand has been increasing faster than the production of indigenous crude oil.
Conclusions:

Crude oil must be imported.
Domestic demand should be reduced.
test_questions.opte: Both I and II follow
test_questions.explanation: The statement mentions that demand for oil is increasing faster than the production. So, either the demand must be reduced or oil must be imported to cope with the increasing demand. Thus, either I or II follows.

test_questions.question:
Statements: He stressed the need to stop the present examination system and its replacement by other methods which would measure the real merit of the students.
Conclusions:

Examinations should be abolished.
The present examination system does not measure the real merit of the students.
test_questions.opte: Both I and II follow
test_questions.explanation: The statement stresses the need to adopt a new method of examination. So, I does not follow. However, II directly follows from the given statement.

test_questions.question:
Statements: Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months.
Conclusions:

Fashion designers do not understand the public mind very well.
The public by and large is highly susceptible to novelty.
test_questions.opte: Both I and II follow
test_questions.explanation: The statement asserts that people cannot stand any particular trend for long and seek change quite often. So, only II follows.

test_questions.question:
Statements: Until our country achieves economic equality, political freedom and democracy would be meaningless.
Conclusions:

Political freedom and democracy go hand in hand.
Economic equality leads to real political freedom and democracy.
test_questions.opte: Both I and II follow
test_questions.explanation: Nothing about the relation between political freedom and democracy is mentioned in the statement. So, I does not follow. But II directly follows from the given statement.

test_questions.question: The attainment of individual and organisational goals is mutually interdependent and linked by a common denominator - employee work motivation. The passage best supports the statement that motivation -
test_questions.opta: encourages an individual to give priority to personal goals over organisational goals.
test_questions.optb: is crucial for the survival of an individual and organisation.
test_questions.optc: is the product of an individual's physical and mental energy.
test_questions.optd: is the external force which induces an individual to contribute his efforts.
test_questions.opte: makes organisation and society inseparable.

There is no  doubt, that from time to time certain seizures were made by the enforcement authorities, during raids and ambush but even allowing these losses the smugglers made huge profits. The passage best supports the statement that
test_questions.opta: smuggling hampers the economic development of a nation.
test_questions.optc: authorities are taking strict measures to curb smuggling.
test_questions.optd: smuggling is fast increasing in our country owing to the quick profit it entails.

test_questions.question: Though the waste of time or the expenditure on fashions is very large, yet fashions have come to stay. They will not go, come what may. However, what is now required is that strong efforts should be made to displace the excessive craze for fashion from the minds of these youngsters. The passage best supports the statement that:
test_questions.opta: fashion is the need of the day.
test_questions.optb: the excessive craze for fashion is detrimental to one's personality.
test_questions.optc: the hoard for fashion should be done away with so as not to let down the constructive development.
test_questions.optd: work and other activities should be valued more than the outward appearance.

In a highly industrialized society, there is no essential difference between Brahmin and Dalit, Muslim and Hindu; they are equally useful and hence equally valuable for in the industrial society individual productivity fixes the size of the pay cheque and this fixes social status. The passage best supports the statement that:
test_questions.optc: human labour has dignity and value.
test_questions.optd: all individuals, irrespective of caste and creed, are born equal.
test_questions.opte: industrial society is a great leveller of men.

test_questions.question: The future of women in India is quite bright and let us hope that they will justify their abilities by rising to the occasion. Napoleon was right when he declared that by educating the women we can educate the whole nation. Because a country can never rise without the contribution of 50% of their population. The passage best supports the statement that:
test_questions.opta: India is striving hard for the emancipation of women.
test_questions.optb: all women should be well educated.
test_questions.optc: a nation can progress only when women are given equal rights and opportunities as men.
test_questions.optd: women ought to be imparted full freedom to prove their worth and contribute to the progress of the nation.

test_questions.question: The prevention of accidents makes it necessary not only that safety devices be used to guard exposed machinery but also that mechanics be instructed in safety rules which they must follow for their own protection, and that lighting in the plant be adequate. The passage best supports the statement that industrial accidents -
test_questions.optd: can be eliminated with the help of safety rules.
test_questions.opte: usually result from inadequate machinery.

test_questions.question: To forgive an injury is often considered to be a sign of weakness; it is really a sign of strength. It is easy to allow oneself to be carried away by resentment and hate into an act of vengeance; but it takes a strong character to restrain those natural passions. The man who forgives an injury proves himself to be the superior of the man who wronged himself and puts the wrong-doer to shame. The passage best supports' the statement that:
test_questions.opta: the sufferer alone knows the intensity of his sufferings.
test_questions.optb: people tend to forgive the things happened in the past.
test_questions.optc: natural passions are difficult to suppress.
test_questions.optd: mercy is the noblest form of revenge.
test_questions.opte: a person with calm and composed nature has depth of thought and vision.

test_questions.question: Industrial exhibitions play a major role in a country's economy. Such exhibitions, now regularly held in Delhi, enable us to measure the extent of our own less advanced industrial progress and the mighty industrial power and progress of countries like the U.K., U.S.A. and Russia whose pavilions are the centres of the greatest attention and attractions. The passage best supports the statement that industrial exhibitions -
test_questions.optb: are more useful for the developed countries like U.S.A. whose products stand out superior to those of the developing countries.
test_questions.optc: are not of much use to the countries who are industrially backward.
test_questions.optd: boost up production qualitatively and quantitatively by analytical comparison of a country's products with those of the developed countries.

test_questions.question: The school has always been the most important means of transferring the wealth of tradition form one generation to the next. This applies today in an even higher degree than in former times for, through the modern development of economy, the family as bearer of tradition and education has become weakened. This passage best supports the statement that for transferring the wealth of tradition from one generation to the next  -
test_questions.opta: there are means other than the school.
test_questions.optb: several different sources must be tried.
test_questions.optc: economic development plays a crucial role
test_questions.optd: modern technology must be put to use.

test_questions.question: Emerson said that the poet was landlord, Sealord, airlord. The flight of imagination made the poet master of land, sea and air. But a poet's dream of yesterday becomes today an actual achievement and a reality for all men. Even those who invented, improved and perfected the aeroplane could hardly have dreamt of the possibility of flight into outer space. The passage best supports the statement that:
test_questions.opta: seemingly impossible imaginations make one a good poet,
test_questions.optb: all imaginations become a reality some day.
test_questions.optc: what man imagined has never been impossible; he has always turned it a reality through his conception of ideas and sheer hard labour.
test_questions.optd: man has reached the climax of technological development with his exploration into outer space.

test_questions.question: It is up to our government and planners to devise ways and means for the mobilisation of about ten crore workers whose families total up about forty crore men, women and children. Our agriculture is over-manned. A lesser number of agriculturists would mean more purchasing or spending power to every agriculturist. This will result in the shortage of man-power for many commodities to be produced for which there will be a new demand from a prosperous agrarian class. This shortage will be removed by surplus man-power released from agriculture as suggested above. The passage best supports the statement that:
test_questions.opta: employment in production is more fruitful than employment in agriculture.
test_questions.optb: Indian economy is in a poor shape basically due to improper mobilisation of man-power.
test_questions.optc: a shift of labour from agricultural sector to the industrial sector would uplift the living standard.
test_questions.optd: the industrial sector is labour-deficient while the agricultural sector is over-manned in our country.

test_questions.question: Exports and imports, a swelling favourable balance of trade, investments and bank-balances, are not an index or a balance sheet of national prosperity. Till the beginning of the Second World War, English exports were noticeably greater than what they are today. And yet England has greater national prosperity today than it ever had. Because the income of average Englishmen, working as field and factory labourers, clerks, policemen, petty shopkeepers and shop assistants, domestic workers and other low-paid workers, has gone up. The passage best supports the statement that:
test_questions.opta: a country's economic standard can be best adjudged by per capital income.
test_questions.optb: a country's balance of trade is the main criteria of determining its economic prosperity.
test_questions.optc: a nation's economy strengthens with the increase in exports.
test_questions.optd: English trade has continually increased since the Second World War.

test_questions.question: Satisfaction with co-workers, promotion opportunities, the nature of work, and pay goes with high performance among those with strong growth needs. Among those with weak growth needs, no such relationship is present - and, in fact, satisfaction with promotion opportunities goes with low performance. This passage best supports the statement that:
test_questions.opta: satisfaction is an inevitable organisational variable.
test_questions.optb: job satisfaction and performance are directly and closely related.
test_questions.optc: relationship between job satisfaction and performance is moderated by growth need.
test_questions.optd: every organisation has few employees having weak growth need.

Through these demands he is stimulated to act as a member of a unity, to emerge from his original narrowness of action and feeling, and to conceive himself from the standpoint of the welfare of the group to which he belongs. The passage best supports the statement that real education -
test_questions.opta: will take place if the children imbibe action and feeling.
test_questions.optb: will take place if the children are physically strong.
test_questions.optc: is not provided in our schools today.
test_questions.optd: comes through the interaction with social situations.
test_questions.opte: comes from the self-centred approach of the students.

test_questions.question: The press should not be afraid of upholding and supporting a just and righteous cause. It should not be afraid of criticising the government in a healthy manner. The press has to be eternally vigilant to protect the rights of the workers, backward and suppressed sections of the society. It should also give a balanced view of the things so that people can be helped in the formation of a healthy public opinion. The passage best supports the statement that
test_questions.opta: press has a great role to play in a democracy.
test_questions.optb: the press is the only means to project to the masses the policies of the government.

test_questions.optd: the press can be used by the governments as an effective media for the upliftment of the backward sections of society.
test_questions.opte: all the information given by the press should be well-articulated so as to gain a good opinion towards the ruling party.

In the last few centuries the businessman has seeded the Industrial Revolution around the world.  The passage best supports the statement that the businessman -
test_questions.optc: is the beneficiary of the Industrial Revolution.
test_questions.optd: is capable of raising his standard of living.

test_questions.opta: managers should have a balanced mind.
test_questions.optb: assembly line will exist in service organisations.
test_questions.optc: interpersonal skills will become more important in the future work place.
test_questions.optd: manufacturing organisations ignore importance of people.
test_questions.opte: service organisations will not deal with objects and things.

It insists that it alone shall touch the work in order to bring it into being. Art requires that nothing shall attain the work except through art itself. This passage best supports the statement that:
test_questions.opta: art is governed by external rules and conditions.
test_questions.optb: art is for the sake of art and life.
test_questions.optc: art is for the sake of art alone.
test_questions.optd: artist realises his dreams through his artistic creation.

test_questions.question: Which word does NOT belong with the others?
test_questions.explanation: Parsley, basil, and dill are types of herbs. Mayonnaise is not an herb.

test_questions.question: Which word does NOT belong with the others?
test_questions.explanation: An ounce measures weight; the other choices measure length.

test_questions.question: Which word does NOT belong with the others?
test_questions.explanation: Tyre, steering wheel, and engine are all parts of a car.

test_questions.question: Which word does NOT belong with the others?
test_questions.explanation: Tulip, rose, and daisy are all types of flowers. A bud is not.

test_questions.question: Which word does NOT belong with the others?
test_questions.explanation:
Loaf, sourdough, and pumpernickel are types of bread. A rye is not a bread type.
Loaf - Bread that is shaped and baked in one piece and usually sliced before being eaten.
Pumpernickel - Dark, dense German bread made from coarsely ground whole-grain rye.
Sourdough - Leaven for making bread, consisting of fermenting dough, typically that left over from a previous batch.
Rye - A wheatlike cereal plant that tolerates poor soils and low temperatures.

test_questions.question: Which word does NOT belong with the others?
test_questions.explanation: The guitar, violin, and cello are stringed instruments; the flute is a wind instrument.

test_questions.question: Which word does NOT belong with the others?
test_questions.explanation: Dodge, duck, and avoid are all synonyms meaning evade. Flee means to run away from.

test_questions.question: Which word does NOT belong with the others?
test_questions.explanation: A branch, leaf, and root are all parts of a tree. The dirt underneath is not a part of the tree.

test_questions.question: Which word does NOT belong with the others?
test_questions.explanation: Freeway, interstate, and expressway are all high- speed highways; a street is for low-speed traffic.

test_questions.question: Which word does NOT belong with the others?
test_questions.explanation: Heading, body, and closing are all parts of a letter;  the letter is the whole, not a part.

test_questions.question: Which word does NOT belong with the others?
test_questions.explanation: The yarn, twine, and cord are all used for tying. The tape is not used in the same way.

test_questions.question: Which word does NOT belong with the others?
test_questions.explanation: A leopard, cougar, and lion all belong to the cat family; an elephant does not.

test_questions.question: Which word does NOT belong with the others?
test_questions.explanation: The couch, table, and chair are pieces of furniture; the rug is not.

test_questions.question: Which word does NOT belong with the others?
test_questions.explanation: The cornea, retina, and pupil are all parts of the eye.

test_questions.question: Which word does NOT belong with the others?
test_questions.explanation: The noun, preposition, and adverb are classes of words that make up a sentence. Punctuation belongs in a sentence, but punctuation is not a class of word.

test_questions.question: Which word does NOT belong with the others?
test_questions.explanation: An index, glossary, and chapter are all parts of a book. Choice a does not belong because the book is the whole, not a part.

test_questions.question: Which word does NOT belong with the others?
test_questions.explanation: The first three choices are all synonyms.

test_questions.question: Vincent has a paper route. Each morning, he delivers 37 newspapers to customers in his neighborhood. It takes Vincent 50 minutes to deliver all the papers. If Vincent is sick or has other plans, his friend Thomas, who lives on the same street, will sometimes deliver the papers for him.
test_questions.opta: Vincent and Thomas live in the same neighborhood.
test_questions.optb: It takes Thomas more than 50 minutes to deliver the papers.
test_questions.optc: It is dark outside when Vincent begins his deliveries.
test_questions.optd: Thomas would like to have his own paper route.
test_questions.explanation: The fact that Vincent and Thomas live on the same street indicates that they live in the same neighborhood. There is no support for any of the other choices.

test_questions.question: The Pacific yew is an evergreen tree that grows in the Pacific Northwest. The Pacific yew has a fleshy, poisonous fruit. Recently, taxol, a substance found in the bark of the Pacific yew, was discovered to be a promising new anticancer drug.
test_questions.opta: Taxol is poisonous when taken by healthy people.
test_questions.optb: Taxol has cured people from various diseases.
test_questions.optc: People should not eat the fruit of the Pacific yew.
test_questions.optd: The Pacific yew was considered worthless until taxol was discovered.
test_questions.explanation: Given the information presented, the only statement that could be considered true is that the fruit should not be eaten because it is poisonous. There is no support that taxol is poisonous or that taxol has cured anyone (choices a and b). There is no support for choice d.

test_questions.question: Erin is twelve years old. For three years, she has been asking her parents for a dog. Her parents have told her that they believe a dog would not be happy in an apartment, but they have given her permission to have a bird. Erin has not yet decided what kind of bird she would like to have.
test_questions.opta: Erin's parents like birds better than they like dogs.
test_questions.optc: Erin and her parents live in an apartment.
test_questions.optd: Erin and her parents would like to move.
test_questions.explanation: Since Erin's parents think a dog would not be happy in an apartment, we can reasonably conclude that the family lives in an apartment. We do not know if Erin's parents dislike dogs (choice a) or if Erin  dislikes birds (choice b).There is no support for choice d.

test_questions.question: Tim's commute never bothered him because there were always seats available on the train and he was able to spend his 40 minutes comfortably reading the newspaper or catching up on paperwork. Ever since the train schedule changed, the train has been extremely crowded, and by the time the doors open at his station, there isn't a seat to be found.
test_questions.opta: Tim would be better off taking the bus to work.
test_questions.optb: Tim's commute is less comfortable since the train schedule changed.
test_questions.optc: Many commuters will complain about the new train schedule.
test_questions.optd: Tim will likely look for a new job closer to home.
test_questions.explanation: The passage tells us that Tim's commute didn't bother  him because he was always able to sit down and comfortably read or do paperwork. Therefore, it is reasonable to assume that Tim's commute has become less comfortable since the schedule change, because it is very crowded and he can no longer find a seat. There is no information given that supports choices a, c, and d.

test_questions.question: When they heard news of the hurricane, Maya and Julian decided to change their vacation plans. Instead of traveling to the island beach resort, they booked a room at a fancy new spa in the mountains. Their plans were a bit more expensive, but they'd heard wonderful things about the spa and they were relieved to find availability on such short notice.
test_questions.opta: Maya and Julian take beach vacations every year.
test_questions.optc: It is usually necessary to book at least six months in advance at the spa.
test_questions.optd: Maya and Julian decided to change their vacation plans because of the hurricane.
test_questions.explanation: The first sentence makes this statement true. There is no support for choice a. The passage tells us that the spa vacation is more expensive than the island beach resort vacation, but that doesn't necessarily mean that the spa is overpriced; therefore, choice b cannot be supported. And even though the paragraph says that the couple was relieved to find a room on short notice, there is no information to support choice c, which says that it is usually necessary to book at the spa at least six months in advance.

test_questions.question: Ten new television shows appeared during the month of September. Five of the shows were sitcoms, three were hour-long dramas, and two were news-magazine shows. By January, only seven of these new shows were still on the air. Five of the shows that remained were sitcoms.
test_questions.opta: Only one of the news-magazine shows remained on the air.
test_questions.optb: Only one of the hour-long dramas remained on the air.
test_questions.optc: At least one of the shows that was cancelled was an hour-long drama.
test_questions.optd: Television viewers prefer sitcoms over hour-long dramas.
test_questions.explanation: If there were seven shows left and five were sitcoms, this means that only two of the shows could possibly be dramas. Choices a and b may be true, but there is no evidence to indicate this as fact. The fact that all of the sitcoms remained does not necessarily mean that viewers prefer sitcoms (choice d).

test_questions.question: On weekends, Mr. Sanchez spends many hours working in his vegetable and flower gardens. Mrs. Sanchez spends her free time reading and listening to classical music. Both Mr. Sanchez and Mrs. Sanchez like to cook.
test_questions.opta: Mr. Sanchez enjoys planting and growing vegetables.
test_questions.optb: Mr. Sanchez does not like classical music.
test_questions.optc: Mrs. Sanchez cooks the vegetables that Mr. Sanchez grows.
test_questions.optd: Mrs. Sanchez enjoys reading nineteenth century novels.
test_questions.explanation: Because Mr. Sanchez spends many hours during the weekend working in his vegetable garden, it is reasonable to suggest that he enjoys this work. There is no information to suggest that he does not like classical music. Although Mrs. Sanchez likes to cook, there is nothing that indicates she cooks vegetables (choice c). Mrs. Sanchez likes to read, but there is no information regarding the types of books she reads (choice d).

test_questions.question: Georgia is older than her cousin Marsha. Marsha's brother Bart is older than Georgia. When Marsha and Bart are visiting with Georgia, all three like to play a game of Monopoly. Marsha wins more often than Georgia does.
test_questions.opta: When he plays Monopoly with Marsha and Georgia, Bart often loses.
test_questions.optb: Of the three, Georgia is the oldest.
test_questions.optc: Georgia hates to lose at Monopoly.
test_questions.optd: Of the three, Marsha is the youngest.
test_questions.explanation: If Georgia is older than Marsha and Bart is older than Georgia, then Marsha has to be the youngest of the three. Choice b is clearly wrong because Bart is the oldest. There is no information in the paragraph to support either choice a or choice c.

test_questions.question: Sara lives in a large city on the East Coast. Her younger cousin Marlee lives in the Mid-west in a small town with fewer than 1,000 residents. Marlee has visited Sara several times during the past five years. In the same period of time, Sara has visited Marlee only once.
test_questions.opta: Marlee likes Sara better than Sara likes Marlee.
test_questions.optb: Sara thinks small towns are boring.
test_questions.optd: Marlee wants to move to the East Coast.
test_questions.explanation: Since the paragraph states that Marlee is the younger cousin, Sara must be older than Marlee. There is no information to support the other choices.
